author: Kohinoor Suthar
title: Phrazle Answer (AM|PM) Today - January 1, 2026
text:
Do you love word puzzles and testing your brain with clever phrases? Phrazle is a fun daily challenge that puts your word-guessing skills to the test! It’s a unique twist on the popular guessing game format, where you solve a hidden phrase in six tries. If you enjoy brain teasers and linguistic puzzles, then Phrazle is definitely for you. Here is the answer for the latest Phrazle for January 1, 2026.
Today’s Phrazle Answer (AM|PM) January 1, 2026 Guessing the correct phrase isn’t easy every time, but it happens! Just keep practicing, and you will get it. You can check out the Phrazle answer for today below.
Note: The team behind Phrazle has reset the number for the puzzle to #1 again on October 18, 2025.
The answer to the morning Phrazle #89 for January 1 is: A Day Late and a Dollar Short
The answer to the afternoon Phrazle #90 for January 1 is: Sticky Wicket
Today’s selections for New Year’s Day offer a humorous and British-influenced start to 2026, touching on themes of poor timing and awkward complications. The morning puzzle features a classic American idiom describing someone who is both too late to be helpful and ill-prepared, while the afternoon puzzle utilizes a term from the sport of cricket to describe a particularly tricky or difficult situation to navigate. Together, these phrases provide a lighthearted look at life’s inevitable setbacks and the complex “wickets” we might face in the coming year. I’d rate it a solid 3 out of 5.

Yesterday’s Phrazle Answer December 31, 2025 Click to reveal the answer to yesterday’s Phrazle was: Morning Answer: Going South
Afternoon Answer : In Memory Of
How to Play Phrazle Phrazle is a word-guessing game inspired by Wordle, where your goal is to deduce a hidden phrase.
The Goal: You need to guess a hidden phrase in six tries. The phrase is broken down into multiple words. Valid Guesses: Your guess must contain the correct number of words and be of a similar length to the answer. Color Clues: After each guess, the tiles will change color to help you: Green: The letter is correct and in the correct position. Yellow: The letter is in the word but in the wrong position. Gray: The letter is not in the phrase at all. Attempts: You get a total of six tries to solve the puzzle. That’s it! Enjoy your daily linguistic challenge!
